definition: Internal feature number.
definition source: Esri
dom value: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

definition: Museum number, lab number, split number, etc.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Source of analytical data for this sample. Foreign key to DataSources table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Strike of planar feature or trend of linear feature, as measured in degrees clockwise from geographic North. Use right-hand rule (dip is to right of azimuth direction). Horizontal planar features may have any azimuth.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Source of data; foreign key to table DataSources.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/
dom value: Arbitrary string that identifies a row in DataSources

definition: Indicates how confidently existence of this line feature has been determined. Values must be defined in Glossary table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Sample ID given at time of collection.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: String that records hierarchical structure. Has form nn-nn-nn, nnn-nnn, or similar. Numeric, left-padded with zeros, delimited with any non-alphanumeric character such as dots, dashes, slashes, etc. Each HierarchyKey fragment of each row MUST be the same length to allow text-based sorting of table entries.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Indicates how confidently this feature has been identified as a particular Type.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Dip of planar feature or plunge of linear feature, as measured in degrees down from horizontal. Negative values allowed when specifying vectors (not axes) that point above the horizon, e.g., paleocurrents. Types defined as horizontal (e.g., horizontal bedding) shall have Inclination = 0.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Indicates whether the line feature is concealed by an overlying map unit.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/
dom value: Boolean values, True/False, Yes/No, Y/N, etc.

definition: Text, with markup tags if desired, to be used for labeling the feature.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Estimated half-width in meters of positional uncertainty envelope; position is relative to other features in database.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Short description of the method of station location; e.g.,'GPS', 'Inspection of USGS 7.5' 2024 US Topo for Cadle Butte, OR', 'highway milepost', etc. Values must be defined in Glossary table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Source of location; foreign key to table DataSources.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/
dom value: Arbitrary string that identifies a row in DataSources.

definition: Short plain-text identifier of the map unit. Foreign key to DescriptionOfMapUnits table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Earth-material that was analyzed, e.g., wood, shell, zircon, basalt, whole-rock.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Additional information specific to a particular feature or table entry.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Estimated circular error (in degrees) of this orientation. For planar features, error is of the orientation of the pole to the plane.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Source of orientation data; foreign key to table DataSources.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/
dom value: Arbitrary string that identifies a row in DataSources

definition: Denominator of smallest map scale at which this point feature should be plotted on map.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Feature geometry.
definition source: Esri

definition: Area of feature in internal units squared.
definition source: Esri
dom value: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

definition: Length of feature in internal units.
definition source: Esri
dom value: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

definition: Unique identifier of station.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Identifier or code for the symbol to be used to portray the feature. Definition here should include the name of the style file, symbol set, gallery, etc. that contains the symbol.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Classifier that specifies what kind of feature is represented by a database element: that a certain line within feature class ContactsAndFaults is a contact, or thrust fault, or water boundary; or that a point in GeochronPoints represents a K-Ar date. Values must be defined in Glossary table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Universal Resource Locator (URL) or Document Object Identifier (DOI), identifies a document on the World Wide Web.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Lines (e.g., cross-section lines) that have no real-world physical existence, such that LocationConfidenceMeters, ExistenceConfidence, and IdentityConfidence attributes are meaningless, and that are never shown as concealed beneath a covering unit. Test
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Lines (box boundaries, internal contacts, brackets, etc.) of the Correlation of Map Units diagram.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Polygons (representing map units) of the Correlation of Map Units diagram.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Points (typically, representing outcrops of a map unit too small to show as polygons at map scale) of the Correlation of Map Units diagram.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Contacts between map units, faults that bound map units, and associated dangling faults. Includes concealed faults and contacts, waterlines, snowfield and glacier boundaries, and map boundary.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: A feature dataset of features depicting the ages and relations of (and among) map units; may include headings and grouping brackets; sometimes shows nonconformities or additional data such as radiometric ages; is not intended to be a true stratigraphic section or column; usually does not include areas of open water, permanent snowfields and glaciers, or unmapped areas. Coordinates should be in page or layout units.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: A feature dataset of features depicting the locations of geologic features in the vertical plane defined by cross-section line [[X]]. Coordinates display features in cross-section view, i.e., X-axis values represent distance along the line of cross-section and Y-axis values represent elevation.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Lines that record the locations of contacts between map units, faults that bound map units, and associated dangling faults within the vertical plane defined by cross-section line [[X]]. Coordinates display features in cross-section view, i.e., X-axis values represent distance along the line of cross-section and Y-axis values represent elevation.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Polygons that record the distribution of map units within the vertical plane defined by cross-section line [[X]]. Coordinates display features in cross-section view, i.e., X-axis values represent distance along the line of cross-section and Y-axis values represent elevation.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Points that record the locations of structural data (e.g., bedding attitudes, foliation attitudes, slip vectors measured at a point, etc.) within the vertical plane defined by cross-section line [[X]]. Coordinates display features in cross-section view, i.e., X-axis values represent distance along the line of cross-section and Y-axis values represent elevation.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Polygons that delineate data sources for all parts of the map.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Non-spatial table of sources of all spatial features, sources of some attributes of spatial features, and sources of some attributes of non-spatial table entries.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Age of map unit as shown in Description of Map Units. Examples of values are "late Holocene", "Pliocene and Miocene", "Lower Cretaceous".
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Text description (e.g., "random small red dashes") provided as a convenience for users who must recreate symbolization.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: RGB color space values that specify the suggested color (e.g., "255, 255, 255", "124, 005, 255") of area-fill for symbolizing MapUnit. Each color value is an integer between 0 and 255. Ideally, values are zero-padded to a length of 3 digits and values are separated by commas.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Free-format text description of map unit. Commonly structured according to one or more accepted traditions, e.g., lithology, thickness, color, weathering and outcrop characteristics, distinguishing features, genesis, age constraints.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Source of map-unit description; foreign key to table Datasources.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Name of map unit including identification of containing higher rank unit(s), e.g., "Shnabkaib Member of Moenkopi Formation".
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Categorization of map unit based on lithologic and genetic character, term selected from NGMDB standard term list defined in Appendix A of GeMS documentation, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/
dom value: "GeoMaterial, Appendix A of GeMS documentation, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS or in the GeoMaterial table included with this database."

definition: Describes the confidence with which the GeoMaterial term describing the map unit was chosen. Values must be defined in Glossary table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Name of map unit, as shown in boldface in traditional DMU, e.g., "Shnabkaib Member". Identifies unit within its hierarchical context.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Token that identifies formatting of paragraph(s) within traditional Description of Map Units that correspond to this table entry.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Non-spatial table that captures content of the Description of Map Units (or equivalent List of Map Units and associated pamphlet text) included in a traditional paper geologic map. Has an internal hierarchy expressed by attribute HierarchyKey
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Stratigraphic interval or numerical age of the fossil.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Source of fossil age; foreign key to table DataSources.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Physical form of the fossil, e.g., mold, cast, true form/preserved remains, trace, carbon film, petrified. Values must be defined in Glossary table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Source of fossil form description; foreign key to table DataSources.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Lowest known taxa of fossil.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Source of fossil taxa; foreign key to table DataSources.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Points that record fossil localities.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: A generic point feature class template with required and suggested fields. This description should be modified to briefly describe the contents of the customized feature class.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Negative (younger) age error, measured in AgeUnits. Type of error (RMSE, 1 sigma, 2 sigma, 95% confidence limit) should be stated in Notes field.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Positive (older) age error, measured in AgeUnits. Type of error (RMSE, 1 sigma, 2 sigma, 95% confidence limit) should be stated in Notes field.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Units for NumericAge, AgePlusError, AgeMinusError.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Numeric age of sample, measured in AgeUnits. May be interpreted from one or several analyses; is not necessarily the date calculated from a single set of measurements.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Points that record the locations of samples and accompanying geochronological measurements. Type field identifies geochronological method.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Lines that represent dikes, coal seams, ash beds, fold hinge-surface traces, isograds, and other linear features. All have these properties: (A) They do not participate in map-unit topology. (B) They correspond to features that exist within the Earth and may be concealed beneath younger, covering, material. (C) They are located with an accuracy that likely can be estimated.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: A feature dataset of features representing the geologic contents of the map.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Plain-language definition of value in Term.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Source of definition; foreign key to DataSources.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Controlled-vocabulary classification of earth materials that is based on general lithologic and genetic character. Terms are defined in Appendix A of GeMS documentation, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Name with addition of leading spaces to help show rank within a hierarchical list.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Non-spatial table that provides values of GeoMaterial, placed in a hierarchy, and their definitions. For further information, see Appendix A in GeMS documentation, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Plain-language term for a concept. Values must be unique within database as a whole.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Non-spatial table that, for certain fields (including all Type fields, GeneralLithology, and fields ending in Confidence and Method), lists the terms that populate these fields, term definitions, and sources for definitions.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Numeric value (e.g., elevation, concentration) associated with an isovalue line (contour, isopleth). Units identified in feature TYPE definition.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Estimated half-width of uncertainty in numeric value (e.g., elevation, concentration) associated with an isovalue line. Units identified in feature TYPE definition. -9 indicates value is not available.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Lines that represent structure contours, concentration isopleths, and other lines that share properties of: (A) Having an associated value (e.g., elevation, concentration) that is a real number. (B ) Having a definable uncertainty in their location. (C) Describing an idealized surface that need not be shown as concealed beneath covering map units.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Polygons that delineate underlying material, overlying material, or some other aspect of earth materials that is described in table DescriptionOfMapUnits, e.g., dike swarm, colluvium. On a map graphic, such polygons are commonly shown by a patterned overprint.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Polygons that record distribution of map units (including water, snowfields, glaciers, and unmapped area) on the particular map horizon.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Name of map property. Examples include "Scale", "Authors and affiliations", "Magnetic declination".
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Value of map property. Examples = "1:24,000", "G.S. Smith1 and J. Doe2 1-Division of Geology, Some State, 2-Big University", "16.5 degrees"
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Properties of the map report as a whole. May include title, authorship, scale, geologic mapping credit, editing credit, cartography credit, date of approval, local magnetic declination, publication series and number, and base map information.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Points that record the locations of structural data (e.g., bedding attitudes, foliation attitudes, slip vectors measured at a point, etc.).
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.

definition: Polygons that delineate underlying material, overlying material, or some aspect of earth materials other than the geologic map unit, e.g., dike swarm, alteration zone. On a map graphic, such polygons are commonly shown by a patterned overprint.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Identifier for symbol from FGDC Digital Cartographic Standard for Geologic Map Symbolization.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Explanation of usage of symbol in this map portrayal.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Explanatory text from FGDC standard for meaning of symbol.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Non-spatial table that identifies symbols from the FGDC Digital Cartographic Standard for Geologic Map Symbolization (FGDC-STD-013-2006) that are "repurposed" for this map.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Name of a rock type or earth material from any vocabulary.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Indicates how lithology is found within this map unit.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/
dom value: "CGI’s Geologic Unit Part Role vocabulary, http://resource.geosciml.org/def/voc/"

definition: Indicates proportion (as qualitative term) of this map unit in which lithology is found.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Indicates proportion (as numeric value) of this map unit in which lithology is found.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Indicates how confidently existence and identity of lithology is identified as being found within this map unit. Values must be defined in Glossary table.
Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Non-spatial table for describing the lithologic constituents of geologic map units. Has one-to-many rows per map unit. May be used to extend and supplement the GeneralLithology terms and unstructured free text Description found in the DescriptionOfMapUnits table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Original identifier given to the station location, usually designated at the time of occupation.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Measured GPS coordinate (easting). May differ from map coordinate because of GPS error or (more likely) base map error.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Measured GPS coordinate (northing). May differ from map coordinate because of GPS error or (more likely) base map error.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Station coordinate (easting) as compiled on the base map; base map should be identified in the DataSources record.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Station coordinate (northing) as compiled on the base map; base map should be identified in the DataSources record.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Records map unit identified in field (or interpreted from remote sensing) as cropping out at this station (see discussion below). Foreign key to DescriptionOfMapUnits table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Name and affiliation of person who located this station.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Position Dilution of Precision measurement from GPS unit; estimator of GPS accuracy.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition:
Significant dimension of exposure (in meters) at this station; e.g., values could be thickness of stratigraphic section 
or depth of auger hole.
Primary key for this table.
definition source: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

definition: Time and date of observation at this station.
Points that record the locations of field observations and (or) samples.
